term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - conventional quantity value
term.title: conventional quantity value

item.text: Quantity value attributed by agreement to a quantity for a given purpose.

notes.item: Sometimes a conventional quantity value is an estimate of a true quantity value.
A conventional quantity value is generally accepted as being associated with a suitably small measurement uncertainty, which might be zero.
In quality assurance and quality control in chemistry, a conventional quantity value, which may be a consensus property value, is often termed "assigned value".

examples.item: Conventional quantity value of a given mass standard, _009521_.
Relative atomic mass for carbon as listed in the IUPAC Green Book.
Consensus property value of the measured values of an interlaboratory comparison.

sources.item: PAC, 2021, 93, 997. 'Metrological and quality concepts in analytical chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 2021)' on page 1004 (https://doi.org/10.1515/pac-2019-0819)
